scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You focused on motivating the team by recalling past successes. Monica's frustration was still palpable, and Bob's agreement seemed to add to the tension. You suggested asking for additional help and compiling a list of needs to present to management. [Monica] leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, 'It's not just about trying hard; we need more resources.' [Bob] muttered, 'Yeah, we're drowning here.' After your suggestion, [Monica] looked slightly relieved but still skeptical, 'What if management says no? We've been turned down before.' [Bob] added, 'And what if they don't understand the urgency?' You emphasized taking immediate action, 'We'll cross that bridge when we get there. For now, let's focus on getting our request in as soon as possible.'
scenes.description: [Monica] taps her fingers on the table impatiently. [Bob] shifts uncomfortably in his seat. [Monica] sighs and says, 'I still have doubts. Even if we put in the request, what's our backup plan?' [Bob] looks at you, waiting for your response.

options.text: Let's brainstorm some backup strategies just in case. We need to be prepared for any outcome.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's concerns and suggested preparing backup plans, demonstrating high empathy and emotional perception.

options.text: We need to stay optimistic and focus on our request for now. We'll handle any setbacks as they come.
options.analysis: You emphasized staying optimistic and handling challenges as they come, showing good self-regulation and social skills.
